Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Noted that patient_age and patient_gender could be used as identifiers to group events.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Inferred that the sequence of activities for a single patient would form a logical progression based on hospital workflows (e.g., registration, triage, consultation, etc.).

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Determined that events with matching patient_age and patient_gender must belong to the same case, as no conflicting data suggests otherwise.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Verified that timestamps and activities for each case form a logical sequence (e.g., registration precedes triage, and discharge concludes a case).

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - IND
Text: Used assumptions about hospital workflows, such as patients moving from registration to triage and then to other departments, to guide grouping.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Identified three distinct cases based on patient attributes and department flows.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Hypothesized that interleaved events belong to separate cases and tested this by matching attributes and sequences.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Rechecked each event to ensure no overlapping or conflicting assignments across cases.
